build.description: Build locator which run on this agent (or is compatible with for queued builds).

name.description: Agent name.

AgentLocator.description: Represents a locator string for filtering Agent entities.

count.description: For paginated calls, how many entities to return per page.

AgentPoolLocator.description: Represents a locator string for filtering AgentPool entities.

count.description: For paginated calls, how many entities to return per page.

id.description: id of the AgentType.

start.description: For paginated calls, from which entity to start rendering the page.

AgentTypeLocator.description: Represents a locator string for filtering AgentType entities.

downloadTimestamp.description: The time when a corresponding file was downloaded.

path.description: The path to the artifact file on a build agent machine that processed the upstream build which published this file.

ArtifactDownloadInfo.description: Stores information about each of the files provided by a build chain build to a downstream dependent build. Can be accessed via the `artifactInfo` field of the `DownloadInfo` object.

affectedProject.description: Related project locator, only single values are supported.

buildType.description: Related build type or template of the action, only single values are supported.

count.description: For paginated calls, how many entities to return per page.

id.description: Event id.

start.description: For paginated calls, from which entity to start rendering the page.

systemAction.description: Is an action made by TeamCity itself.

user.description: Locator of user who caused the audit event.

x-model-examples: `count:1000`  find last `1000` audit events.
`user:(<userLocator>)`  find last 100 events by user found by `userLocator`.
AuditLocator.description: Represents a locator string for filtering AuditEvent entities.

count.description: For paginated calls, how many entities to return per page.

name.description: Branch name.

start.description: For paginated calls, from which entity to start rendering the page.

unspecified.description: Branch is unspecified if for some reason TeamCity failed to find appropriate branch name for the build.

x-model-examples: `build:<buildLocator>` - find branch with which the build found by `buildLocator` was started.
`buildType:<buildTypeLocator>` - find branches of a build configuration found by `buildTypeLocator`.
BranchLocator.description: Represents a locator string for filtering Branch entities.

name.description: The name of an external executor that processed this build.

BuildExecutor.description: Represents an executor of a build.

agentTypeId.description: typeId of agent used to execute build.

count.description: For paginated calls, how many entities to return per page.

defaultFilter.description: If true, applies default filter which returns only "normal" builds (finished builds which are not canceled, not failed-to-start, not personal, and on default branch (in branched build configurations)).

finishDate.description: Requires either date or build dimension.

id.description: Entity ID.

item.description: Supply multiple locators and return a union of the results.

lookupLimit.description: Limit processing to the latest `<lookupLimit>` entities.

queuedDate.description: Requires either date or build dimension.

start.description: For paginated calls, from which entity to start rendering the page.

startDate.description: Requires either date or build dimension.

taskId.description: ID of a build or build promotion.

user.description: For personal builds checks the owner of the build, triggerring user in other cases.

x-model-examples: `id:1`  find build with ID `1`.
`buildType:<buildTypeLocator>`  find builds under build configuration found by `buildTypeLocator`.
`defaultFilter:false,agent:<agentLocator>`  find builds executed on agent found by `agentLocator`, with `defaultFilter` disabled (see below).
BuildLocator.description: Represents a locator string for filtering Build entities.

count.description: For paginated calls, how many entities to return per page.

id.description: Entity ID.

item.description: Supply multiple locators and return a union of the results.

start.description: For paginated calls, from which entity to start rendering the page.

x-model-examples: `buildType:<buildTypeLocator>`  find queued builds under build configuration found by buildTypeLocator.
`user:<userLocator>`  find queued builds started by user found by userLocator.
BuildQueueLocator.description: Represents a locator string for filtering Build entities.

comment.description: Your custom note that explains why the build status was manually changed.

BuildStatusUpdate.description: Send instances of this class to the `/app/rest/builds/<locator>/status` endpoint to change the status of a build to either 'SUCCESS' or 'FAILURE'. This replicates the *Mark as failed...* and *Mark as successful...* operations available from the 'Actions' menu on the build results page in TeamCity UI.

enforceCleanCheckout.description: Returns **true** if the agent should clear the build checkout directory before checking out sources from the VCS; otherwise, **false**.

enforceCleanCheckoutForDependencies.description: Returns **true** if the `enforceCleanCheckout` behavior should all apply to all snapshot dependencies of this build; otherwise, **false**.

parameters.description: The list of customized properties for the build started by this trigger.

BuildTriggerCustomization.description: Passed to the `Trigger.buildCustomization` property to trigger a customized build.

count.description: For paginated calls, how many entities to return per page.

item.description: Supply multiple locators and return a union of the results.

start.description: For paginated calls, from which entity to start rendering the page.

x-model-examples: `name:MyBuildType`  find build configuration with `MyBuildType` name
`project:<projectLocator>`  find build configurations under project found by `projectLocator`
BuildTypeLocator.description: Represents a locator string for filtering BuildType entities.

count.description: For paginated calls, how many entities to return per page.

id.description: Entity ID.

item.description: Supply multiple locators and return a union of the results.

sinceChange.description: Commit SHA since which the changes should be returned.

start.description: For paginated calls, from which entity to start rendering the page.

x-model-examples: `username:MyVCSUsername`  find last 100 changes made by user with `MyVCSUsername` VCS username.
`pending:true,buildType:<buildTypeLocator>`  find all pending changes on build configuration found by `buildTypeLocator`.
ChangeLocator.description: Represents a locator string for filtering Change entities.

runningBuilds.description: The number of currently running builds processing this change, regardless of their current build status.

finishedBuilds.description: The number of finished builds that processed this change, regardless of their final status.

cancelledBuilds.description: Returns how many of `finishedBuilds` were cancelled before they finished.

runningSuccessfullyBuilds.description: The number of builds that process this change and are currently running with the 'running and failing' status.

queuedBuildsCount.description: The number of currently queued builds whose list of processed changes includes this change.

pendingBuildTypes.description: The number of build configurations (build types) that have not yet processed this change and have it in their 'pending changes' list.

totalProblems.description: The total number of build problems associated with this change, across all build configurations and their builds.

otherFailedTests.description: The total number of failed tests associated with this change. This number does not inlcude the number of new test failures.

successfulBuilds.description: Returns how many of `finishedBuilds` finished successfully.

newFailedTests.description: The total number of new failed tests associated with this change, across all build configurations and their builds.

ChangeStatus.description: Stores information this change in terms of effects it had on the TeamCity server: the number of failed/cancelled/successful builds, the number of build configurations that have this change in the pending changes list, the number of build problems and failed tests caused by this change, and so on. Fairly expensive to compute.

type.description:
Returns the following values depending on the authority that triggered this build: 

* *user* if the build was triggered manually in TeamCity UI or via REST API.
* *snapshotDependency* if the build is a part of a build chain and was requested by a downstream build configuration.
* *vcs* if the build was initiated by the VCS Trigger that found new commits in the remote repository.
* *schedule* if the build was initiated by the Schedule Trigger.
* *finishBuild* if the build was initiated by the Finish Build Trigger.
* *retry* if the build was initiated by the Retry Trigger that re-starts failed builds.

details.description: Optional details regarding the triggering event.

date.description: The timestamp of the build triggering.

displayText.example: Snapshot dependency; Finish Build Trigger; Pet Clinic / Update Packages, build #27
displayText.description: The summary displayed next to the 'Triggered' line in TeamCity UI. Enumerates authorities that caused this build to run and displays the build's parent configuration name and number.

rawValue.description: The string representation of the `properties` array.

user.description: Identifies the user who initiated a build, directly or indirectly. Indirectly means they initiated another build that eventuated the current one (for example, started a dependent build or triggered a build that failed and was then restarted by the Retry Trigger). Builds initiated by the Schedule Trigger do not have a related user.

build.description: A separate build that caused this one to run. Can co-exist with the `user` field: for example, if a user triggered build A that requested (via a snapshot dependency) build B, the latter will have links to both the build A and the user who initiated it.

buildType.description: The parent build configuration of the `build`.

properties.description: The array of name-value pairs containing service information about the triggered build and the events that initiated it.

TriggeredBy.description: Identifies the authority that triggered this build.

TypedValueSet.description: Represents a named set of predefined typed values.

status.description:
The status of the changes check.

* **finished**  the check for changes is complete, no new check is scheduled.
* **scheduled**  the new check for changes is scheduled.
* **started**  a check for changes is currently in progress.

requestorType.description:
The authority that issued a check for changes request. 

* **schedule**  a check for changes is initiated by the TeamCity server, as a part of default repository polling mechanism.
* **build**  a default check for changes that preceds any new build starting.
* **user**  a TeamCity user clicked the configuration's 'Check for pending changes' action in TeamCity UI.
* **commit_hook**  a check for changes was triggered by a [post-commit webhook](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/configuring-vcs-post-commit-hooks-for-teamcity.html).

timestamp.description: The time of the latest check entry.

VcsCheckStatus.description: Stores information on the last known remote repository check for new changes.

id.description: An integer value that is the unique agent identificator.

name.description: The public agent name. Cloud agent names are typically formed by appending the unique instance name to the parent cloud profile name.

typeId.description: Returns the unique ID of the agent category. Local standalone have unique type IDs whereas cloud agents spawned from the same cloud image have the same type ID.

connected.description: Returns *true* if the agent is connected to the TeamCity server; otherwise, *false*. Connected agents are those that can communicate with the TeamCity server.

enabled.description:
Returns *true* if the agent is enabled; otherwise, *false*. Enabled agents are those that are ready to process new bulds.

Send `PUT` requests to the [`/app/rest/agents/{agentLocator}/enabledInfo`](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/rest/agentapi.html#setEnabledInfo) endpoint to manually enable or disable agents.

authorized.description:
Returns *true* if the agent is authorized on the server; otherwise, *false*. Authorized agents are those that are granted permission to execute building tasks on this TeamCity server.

Send `PUT` requests to the [`/app/rest/agents/{agentLocator}/authorizedInfo`](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/rest/agentapi.html#setAuthorizedInfo) endpoint to manually authorize or unauthorize agents.

uptodate.description: Returns *true* if both `outdated` and `pluginsOutdated` properties return *false*; *false* if any of these properties returns *true*.

outdated.description: Returns *true* for outdated agents that require an update; *false* for agents that are up to date. Agents typically update their software automatically and do not require any actions from your side.

pluginsOutdated.description: Returns *false* if all plugins installed on this agent are of the latest version; *true* if some of plugins are outdated. Plugins installed from the JetBrains Marketplace are typically updated automatically.

javaOutdated.description: Returns *true* the Java version installed on the agent machine is outdated; otherwise, *false*.

ip.description: The IP address of the agent machine.

protocol.description:
Returns the agent-server communication protocol type:

* *unidirectional*  the default one-way communication protocol. Unidirectional agents establish an HTTP(S) connection to the TeamCity server, and periodically poll it for server commands.
* *bidirectional*  [no longer supported](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/upgrade-notes.html#Canceled+bidirectional+agent-server+communication+protocol) in TeamCity 2021.2 and newer.

version.description: The actual version of the agent software or 'unknown' if the agent is disconnected. If this version differs from the version expected by the server (the `currentAgentVersion` property), the agent is considered outdated.

currentAgentVersion.description: The version of the agent software that is expected by the current TeamCity server. Matches the build number of this server (can be obtained from the `/app/rest/server/build` endpoint).

lastActivityTime.description:
The timestamp of the last comminication between this agent and the TeamCity server.

To get the last time this agent performed an activity different from periodic server polling (for example, ran a build), use the `idleSinceTime` property instead.

idleSinceTime.description: The timestamp of the last meaningful agent activity (for example, running a build). For agents that never ran a build after they were authorized by the server, this timestamp is typically equal to the `registrationTimestamp` property value.

disconnectionComment.description: The summary that explains why this agent was disconnected. Returns `null` for connected agents.

registrationTimestamp.description: The timestamp of the first successful agent authorization on this server.

host.description: The name of the agent machine host.

cpuRank.description: An integer value that is the [benchmarking score](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/viewing-build-agent-details.html#Agent+Summary) of the agent machine's CPU.

port.description: The port used by the TeamCity server to connect to the agent.

href.description: Returns the shortened (without the server URL) link to the current agent. To obtain the full URL, use the *webUrl* property instead.

webUrl.description: Returns the full web link to access this agent. To get a shortened link without the server URL, read the *href* property instead.

build.description: Returns the build currently processed by this agent, or *null* if the agent is idle.

links.description: Returns the collection of links to this build.

enabledInfo.description:
An [EnabledInfo](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/rest/enabledinfo.html) object that stores the information about the agent availability: the current state, the scheduled time this state should automatically flip (for temporarily disabled agents), and metadata related to the last time this state was modified (the timestamp, the user who did it, and their optional comment). 

Send `PUT` requests to the [`/app/rest/agents/{agentLocator}/enabledInfo`](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/rest/agentapi.html#setEnabledInfo) endpoint to manually enable or disable agents.

authorizedInfo.description:
An [AuthorizedInfo](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/rest/authorizedinfo.html) object that returns the current agent authorization state and the metadata related to the last time this state was changed (the timestamp, the user who did it, and their optional comment). 

Send `PUT` requests to the [`/app/rest/agents/{agentLocator}/authorizedInfo`](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/rest/agentapi.html#setAuthorizedInfo) endpoint to manually authorize or unauthorize agents.

properties.description: The list of all standard and custom [parameters](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/rest/manage-typed-parameters.html) known to the agent.

cloudInstance.description:
The cloud instance that runs this agent. A cloud instance is an individual cloud machine spawned from a cloud image.

Cloud instance objects store infrastructure information about the agent's machine: its network address, state (starting, running or stopped), errors that prevent it from starting, and so on.

cloudImage.description: The cloud image that spawned a cloud instance on which the current agent runs.

environment.description: Returns an object that stores the agent machine's OS version and type

pool.description:
Returns an object that specifies the pool to which this agent belongs.

Send a `POST` request to the [`/app/rest/agentPools/{agentPoolLocator}/agents`](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/rest/agentpoolapi.html#addAgentToAgentPool) endpoint to move an agent to a different pool.

compatibilityPolicy.description:
Returns whether the agent can run only builds of specific build configurations.

* If the agent can run builds of any compatible configuration (the default behavior), the `compatibilityPolicy.policy` property returns 'any' and `compatibilityPolicy.buildTypes` is null.
* If the agent has specific build configurations assigned to it, the `compatibilityPolicy.policy` property is 'selected' and the `compatibilityPolicy.buildTypes` list returns these assigned build configurations.

compatibleBuildTypes.description: Returns the list of all build configurations whose builds can be processed by this agent. An agent can be incompatible with specific build configurations if it does not meet [agent requirements](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/agent-requirements.html) of these configurations.

incompatibleBuildTypes.description: Returns all build configurations incompatible with this agent as a list of [Compatibility](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/rest/compatibility.html) objects. Each `Compatibility` object includes a `BuildType` instance that represents an incompatible configuration and a list of unmet requirements (the [Requirements](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/rest/requirements.html) object).

builds.description: The build history of this agent (the list of builds processed by it).

removed.description: Returns *true* if the agent was removed after a long period of inactivity; otherwise, *false*.

id.description: The internal read-only ID of the object. This property is inherited from the base PropEntity class.

name.description: The public object name. Some objects, like build steps, support public names, while others, like build triggers, do not. This property is inherited from the base PropEntity class.

type.description: The object type. This property is inherited from the base PropEntity class.

disabled.description: Returns **rue** if the object is disabled and inactive; otherwise, **false**. This property is inherited from the base PropEntity class.

inherited.description: Returns **rue** if the object is inherited from another object; otherwise, **false**. This property is inherited from the base PropEntity class.

href.description: Returns the shortened (without the server URL) link to the current object. This property is inherited from the base PropEntity class.

properties.description: The list of main object settings. Each setting is a Property instance with `name` and `value` fields. This property is inherited from the base PropEntity class.

agent-requirement.description: A build configuration's (or template's) requirement for agent parameters. Non-compliant agents cannot run builds spawned by the configuration.

count.description: The number of `agent-requirement` objects in this collection.

agent-requirement.description: The list of `agent-requirement` objects owned by this collection.

agent-requirements.description: Represents a list of AgentRequirement entities.

id.description: The unique ID of this pool. The Default pool has the ID value of *0*.

name.description: The public name of the pool.

href.description: Returns the shortened (without the server URL) link to the current pool.

maxAgents.description: The pool capacity. Returns *null* for pools with the unlimited number of agent slots.

ownerProject.description:
Returns the corresponding project for [project pool](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/configuring-agent-pools.html#Agents+Tab). A project pool is an automatically created agent pool for cloud agents spawned from cloud images that belong to this (non-Root) project. These agents can run builds of the corresponding project only.

Regular (non-project) pools return *null*.

projects.description:
Returns the list of projects assigned to this pool. Pool agents can run builds of these assigned projects only.

Send [`POST`](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/rest/agentpoolapi.html#addProjectToAgentPool) and [`DELETE`](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/rest/agentpoolapi.html#deleteProjectFromAgentPool) requests to the `/app/rest/agentPools/{poolLocator}/projects` endpoint to change the list of projects assigned to this pool.

agents.description:
The list of agents owned by this pool.

Send [`POST`](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/rest/agentpoolapi.html#addAgentToAgentPool) requests to the `/app/rest/agentPools/{agentPoolLocator}/agents` endpoint to add agents to the required pool. To remove an agent from the specific pool, add this agent to the Default (id:0) pool.

agentPool.description: An agent pool that is the group of agents with shared permissions and available projects.

count.description: The current number of AgentPool objects in this list.

href.description: The relative link (without the server URL) used to retrieve this object.

nextHref.description: If the list of returned entities exceeds the request `count` value, TeamCity splits it into multiple batches. This property returns the endpoint that allows you to obtain the next batch.

prevHref.description: If the list of returned entities exceeds the request `count` value, TeamCity splits it into multiple batches. This property returns the endpoint that allows you to obtain the previous batch.

agentPool.description: The list of AgentPools owned by this collection.

agentPools.description: Represents a paginated list of AgentPool entities.

name.description: The name of a local agent or a cloud image that belongs to this type.

id.description: An integer value that is the unique agent identificator.

buildParameters.description: Returns a list of agent parameters that are accessible by builds running on an agent of this type. Typically returns a combination of `environmentParameters` and `systemParameters`.

environment.description: An Environment object that stores information about an operating system installed on the agent machine.

configurationParameters.description: Returns a portion of `availableParameters` list that contains only configuration parameters, excluding environment variables and system properties.

availableParameters.description: The list of all pre-defined and custom build parameters known to this agent.

isCloud.description: Returns *true* if this type identifies agents spawned from a cloud image; *false* if this type identifies a local stand-alone agent.

environmentParameters.description: Returns a portion of `availableParameters` list that contains only environment variables, excluding system and configuration parameters.

systemParameters.description: Returns a portion of `availableParameters` list that contains only system parameters, excluding environment variables and configuration parameters.

agentType.description: The agent type that describes common properties shared by all agents of this type. Stand-alone local agents are the only representatives of their corresponding types, whereas cloud agents spawned from the same cloud image belong to the same type.

count.description: The current number of AgentType objects in this list.

agentType.description: The list of AgentTypes owned by this collection.

prevHref.description: If the list of returned entities exceeds the request `count` value, TeamCity splits it into multiple batches. This property returns the endpoint that allows you to obtain the previous batch.

nextHref.description: If the list of returned entities exceeds the request `count` value, TeamCity splits it into multiple batches. This property returns the endpoint that allows you to obtain the next batch.

href.description: The relative link (without the server URL) used to retrieve this object.

agentTypes.description: Represents a paginated list of AgentType entities.

count.description: The current number of Agent objects in this list.

nextHref.description: If the list of returned entities exceeds the request `count` value, TeamCity splits it into multiple batches. This property returns the endpoint that allows you to obtain the next batch.

prevHref.description: If the list of returned entities exceeds the request `count` value, TeamCity splits it into multiple batches. This property returns the endpoint that allows you to obtain the previous batch.

href.description: The relative link (without the server URL) used to retrieve this object.

agent.description: The list of Agents owned by this collection.

agents.description: Represents a paginated list of Agent entities.

description.example: This build is considered untrusted because it processes potentially unsafe pull request refs/pull/2/head
description.description: A description of why this build requires an approval: either a Build Approval build feature or Untrusted Builds project settings are configured.

url.description: If a build requires an approval because of Untrusted Builds project settings, this field stores a link to a related pull (merge) request. Otherwise, if a build is delayed by the Build Approval build feature, this field returns `null`.

approvableBuild.description: A summary of why the build requires an approval.

buildChainBuilds.description: The list of other builds (both upstream and downstream) that belong to the same build chain and require an approval.

configurationValid.description: Returns *true* if the configuration of users and user groups that should approve this build is valid; otherwise, *false*.

timeoutTimestamp.description: The timestamp when the build is (or was) canceled due to reviewers failing to approve it on time. This value is calculated at the moment a build is queued.

groupApprovals.description: The list of user groups whose users need to approve a build before it can start.

canBeApprovedByCurrentUser.description: Returns *true* if the currently authorized user is among TeamCity users who can approve this build; otherwise, *false*.

userApprovals.description: The list of indvidual users whose approval is required to start a build.

approvalReasons.description: Returns the reasons why TeamCity is waiting for build approval.

approvalInfo.description: If a build cannot start without a manual approval from specific reviewers, it stores related information in a related ApprovalInfo object.

count.description: The number of `artifact_dependency` objects in this collection.

artifact-dependency.description: The list of `artifact_dependency` objects owned by this collection.

artifact-dependencies.description: Represents a list of ArtifactDependency entities.

id.description: The internal read-only ID of the object. This property is inherited from the base PropEntity class.

name.description: The public object name. Some objects, like build steps, support public names, while others, like build triggers, do not. This property is inherited from the base PropEntity class.

type.description: The object type. This property is inherited from the base PropEntity class.

disabled.description: Returns **rue** if the object is disabled and inactive; otherwise, **false**. This property is inherited from the base PropEntity class.

inherited.description: Returns **rue** if the object is inherited from another object; otherwise, **false**. This property is inherited from the base PropEntity class.

href.description: Returns the shortened (without the server URL) link to the current object. This property is inherited from the base PropEntity class.

properties.description: The list of main object settings. Each setting is a Property instance with `name` and `value` fields. This property is inherited from the base PropEntity class.

source-buildType.description: The upstream build configuration that produces files (artifacts) that should be imported by the current build configuration.

artifact-dependency.description: An artifact dependency that defines rules for passing artifacts from an upstream build configuration to a target downstream configuration.

name.description: The type of the action. See [AuditLocator](auditLocator.md) for the list of supported values.

id.description: The automatically generated unique ID of the action.

pattern.description: The description of the audit action displayed in TeamCity UI.Includes placeholders for the name of the affected entity (for example, a build configuration whose settings were edited), username of a person who performed the action, link that opens the corresponding changes diff, and so on.

auditAction.description: Contains details about a user action tracked by a corresponding [AuditEvent](auditEvent.md).

id.description: The automatically generated unique ID of the event.

timestamp.description: The time of the logged event.

comment.example: runners of 'Retrieve Issues' build configuration were updated
comment.description: The event summary that briefly explains its essence. Certain events (such as starting a build) have no comment attached.

action.description: A corresponding AuditAction object that contains additional information about this event.

relatedEntities.description: The list of objects associated with this change. For example, when starting a build, the only related entity is the new build instance itself. In turn, granting a role to a user generates three related entities: the user granted a new role, the role itself, and a TeamCity project for which this role was granted.

user.description: A TeamCity user who performed the logged event.

auditEvent.description: An audit event that stores information about all meaningful actions performed by every TeamCity user.

count.description: The current number of AuditEvent objects in this list.

nextHref.description: If the list of returned entities exceeds the request `count` value, TeamCity splits it into multiple batches. This property returns the endpoint that allows you to obtain the next batch.

prevHref.description: If the list of returned entities exceeds the request `count` value, TeamCity splits it into multiple batches. This property returns the endpoint that allows you to obtain the previous batch.

href.description: The relative link (without the server URL) used to retrieve this object.

auditEvent.description: The list of audit events owned by this collection that satisfy the given locator.

auditEvents.description: Represents a paginated list of AuditEvent entities.

count.description: Number of tokens to generate.

authorizationTokensRequirements.description: Represents requirements for the list of authorization tokens to be generated.

status.description: Returns *true* if the current object state is enabled (for example, pinned for build `PinInfo` or authorized for agent `AuthorizedInfo`; otherwise, *false*.

comment.description: Contains detailed information about current `status` value: the time it was set, the user who did it, and their personal notes on the event.This timestamp and the user data are automatically generated and cannot be changed.

authorizedInfo.description: Contains information about agent authorization state. Send AuthorizedInfo objects to the [`/app/rest/agents/{agentLocator}/authorizedInfo`](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/rest/agentapi.html#setAuthorizedInfo) endpoint via `PUT` requests to manually authorize and unauthorize agents.

name.description: A public branch name displayed in TeamCity UI. To get a full VCS name instead (for example, 'refs/heads/main'), read the *vcsBranchName* property of a nested Revision entity.

internalName.description: An internal branch name. Returns `<default>` for default branches, and real branch names for other (non-default) branches.

default.description: Returns **true** if this branch is the default branch of this build configuration; otherwise, **false**. When obtaining builds of the specific BuildType, add the *branch(default:any)* locator to get builds from all existing branches.

unspecified.description: Returns **true** for unspecified branches; otherwise, **false**. A branch is labeled as unspecified when TeamCity fails to find a branch for this build. Such branches have a predefined '<unspecified>' name.

active.description: Returns **true** for active branches and **false** for inactive ones. A branch is considered inactive if it had neither new TeamCity builds in the last 24 hours, nor recent VCS repository changes in the last 7 days. Learn more: [Active branches](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/working-with-feature-branches.html#Active+Branches).

lastActivity.description: Returns the date and time of the last branch activity (the last TeamCity build or the latest VCS commit).

groupFlag.description: Returns **true** if the branch belongs to the automatically created 'My Branches' group; otherwise, **false**. Branch grouping allows TeamCity to automatically categorize branches based on current TeamCity user commits.

builds.description: Returns all builds that target this branch.

branch.description: Represents a branch of the remote repository that stores sources processed by this build.

version.description: The full revision SHA. Points to the latest commit in this branch.

name.description: A public branch name displayed in TeamCity UI. To get a full VCS name instead (for example, 'refs/heads/main'), read the *vcsBranchName* property of a nested Revision entity.

default.description: Returns **true** if this branch is the default branch of this build configuration; otherwise, **false**. When obtaining builds of the specific BuildType, add the *branch(default:any)* locator to get builds from all existing branches.

active.description: Returns **true** for active branches and **false** for inactive ones. A branch is considered inactive if it had neither new TeamCity builds in the last 24 hours, nor recent VCS repository changes in the last 7 days. Learn more: [Active branches](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/working-with-feature-branches.html#Active+Branches).

internalName.description: An internal branch name. Returns `<default>` for default branches, and real branch names for other (non-default) branches.

lastActivity.description: Returns the date and time of the last branch activity (the last TeamCity build or the latest VCS commit).

builds.description: Returns all builds that target this branch.

unspecified.description: Returns **true** for unspecified branches; otherwise, **false**. A branch is labeled as unspecified when TeamCity fails to find a branch for this build. Such branches have a predefined '<unspecified>' name.

groupFlag.description: Returns **true** if the branch belongs to the automatically created 'My Branches' group; otherwise, **false**. Branch grouping allows TeamCity to automatically categorize branches based on current TeamCity user commits.

branchVersion.description: An object that describes the actual state of a repository branch. Inherits the majority of its properties from the base Branch class.

count.description: The current number of Branch objects in this list.

href.description: The relative link (without the server URL) used to retrieve this object.

branch.description: The list of branches owned by this collection that satisfy the given locator.

branches.description: Represents a list of Branch entities.

id.description: The automatically generated unique ID of the build.

buildTypeId.description: Returns the ID of the corresponding build configuration. To obtain this configuration itself, use the *buildType* property instead.

buildTypeInternalId.description: This property supports the internal infrastructure and is not intented to be used. Use the *buildTypeId* property instead to access the regular build configuration ID.

number.description: Returns a public build number this build is assigned in its build configuration, *null* if a build is still queued, or *N/A* if a queued build was canceled before it started.

status.description:
Returns whether a build has finished successfully (or is expected to finish so, if still running). Possible values: 

* *null* for queued builds. 
* *SUCCESS* for builds that have successfully finished or still running without errors. 
* *FAILURE* for builds that failed to start or failed during their run. 
* *UNKNOWN* for canceled builds.

state.description: Returns the actual stage of the build's lifecycle: queued, running, or finished.

running.description: Returns *true* if the build is currently running; otherwise, *false*.

composite.description: Returns *true* if this is build is composite; otherwise, *false*.Composite builds aggregate results of multiple child builds. These builds can belong to [composite build configurations](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/composite-build-configuration.html) or can be spawned automatically (for example, to aggregate results of parallel tests).

failedToStart.description: Returns *true* if this build was automatically removed from the building queue (for example, if an error occured or the appointed reviewers failed to [approve the build](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/cloud/build-approval.html) in time); otherwise, *false*.Does not return *true* for manually cancelled builds

personal.description: Returns *true* for [personal builds](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/personal-build.html) and *false* for regular builds.

percentageComplete.description: This property is deprecated, see *running-info* property instead.

branchName.description: Returns the name of the repository branch whose changes are processed in the current build. This property returns the [logical branch name](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/working-with-feature-branches.html#Logical+Branch+Name) (*main*), not a fully specified VCS branch name (*refs/heads/main*).

defaultBranch.description: Returns *true* if the current build processes changes from the branch specified as default branch in VCS root settings; otherwise, *false*.

unspecifiedBranch.description: Returns *true* if the branch name equals `<unspecified>`; otherwise, *false*. A branch can have this name if TeamCity fails to retrieve a valid branch name.

history.description: Returns *true* for [history builds](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/history-build.html) that started after a build with most recent code changes; otherwise, *false*.

pinned.description: Returns *true* if the build is currently [pinned](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/build-actions.html#Pin+Build); otherwise, *false*.Send GET and PUT requests to `/app/rest/builds/<build-locator>/pinInfo` to get the detailed information about pinned builds and manually pin/unpin these builds.

href.description: Returns the shortened (without the server URL) link to the current build. To obtain the full URL, use the *webUrl* property instead.

webUrl.description: Returns the full web link to access this build. To get a link without the server URL, read the *href* property instead.

queuePosition.description: Returns the build's position in the building queue.

limitedChangesCount.description: Returns the number of changes processed in this build.

artifactsDirectory.description: Returns the path to the built-in artifact storage.

links.description: Returns the collection of links to this build.

statusText.description: Returns the additional information about the finished or running build. Returns nothing if a build is still queued, read the *waitReason* property instead to get the current status of a queued build.In TeamCity UI, this string is displayed next to the build status icon ("Canceled", "Step 3/7", "Error while applying patch", and so on).

buildType.description: Returns the build configuration to which the current build belongs.

comment.description: Returns the comment for this build, and the user who wrote it.

tags.description: Returns the collection of [tags](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/build-actions.html#Add+Tags+to+Build) that decorate this build.

pinInfo.description: Allows you to identify who and when pinned this build. Returns *null* for builds whose *pinned* is *false*.

user.description: Returns the user associated with this personal build, or *null* of this build is not personal.

startEstimate.description: If this build is still queued, this property returns the estimated time (UTC) of an actual build start.

waitReason.example: There are no idle compatible agents which can run this build
waitReason.description: Returns the actual reason why this build remains in build queue. This property returns the most recent wait reason from the *queuedWaitReasons* array.

finishEstimate.description: Returns the estimated time this build will finish. Returns a value only for queued builds and *null* for those that already run.

delayedByBuild.description: Returns the build that must finish before the currently queued build can start.

plannedAgent.description: Returns the agent that TeamCity currently expects to assign to this queued build. Use *compatibleAgents* instead to obtain the list of all agents that can run this build.

approvalInfo.description: Allows you to identify who and when allowed this build to start. This information is written if a build configuration has the [Build Approval feature](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/cloud/build-approval.html) configured and/or the project [Untrusted Builds](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/untrusted-builds.html) settings filter out potentially harmful builds.

running-info.description: Returns the RunningBuildInfo object that stores data related to the build completion stage: completion percentage, elapsed and remaining time, build health (hanging or running as expected), and so on.Returns *null* for queued and finished builds.

canceledInfo.description: Allows you to retrieve detailed information about this canceled build: a user who canceled it, their comment, and the cancel timestamp. Returns *null* for non-canceled builds.

queuedDate.description: Returns the date and time (UTC) when this build was queued. Note that the moment this build actually starts is stored in the different property (*startDate*)..

startDate.description: Returns the date and time (UTC) of the moment the build actually started. Note that the moment a build was triggered is stored in the *queuedDate* property.

finishDate.description: Returns the date and time of the moment the build was removed from the queue (finished, failed, or was canceled). The value is in UTC and corresponds to the server timezone.

triggered.description: Allows you to identify the time this build was triggered, and the authority that ussued the build command (user, vcs trigger, schedule trigger, and so on).

lastChanges.description: Returns the topmost element of the *changes* collection. Corresponds to the latest change processed in this build.

changes.description: Returns the list of changes processed in this build. Use *limitedChangesCount* to obtain the number of these changes, or *lastChanges* to get the latest one.

revisions.description: Returns the list of revisions associated with this build. When adding a new build to a build queue, use this property instead of `changes` or `lastChange` to choose a specific version of sources.

versionedSettingsRevision.description: Returns the revision of build configuration settings stored in a VCS.

artifactDependencyChanges.description: If this build belongs to a consumer configuration whose builds import artifacts from builds of another (source) configuration, this property allows you to identify whether previous consumer builds obtained their artifacts from different source builds or the same one. This collection is empty if both source and consumer builds belong to the same build chain.

agent.description: Returns a build agent that processed (or currently processes) this build.If the build has not yet started and awaits in the build queue, this property returns *null*. In this case you can check the *plannedAgent* property to obtain the agent that will likely run the build.

compatibleAgents.description: If a build is still in building queue, this property returns the list of all agents that can run it. Use *plannedAgent* to obtain an agent from this list that TeamCity expects to assign to this build.

compatibleCloudImages.description: Returns all [cloud images](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/teamcity-integration-with-cloud-solutions.html) that can spawn agents compatible with this build.

testOccurrences.description: Returns the TestOccurences object that stores information on test instances run in this build.

problemOccurrences.description: Returns the list of build problems that led to the build failure.

artifacts.description: Returns the list of public build artifacts. See this section for the examples of downloading specific files: [Get Build Artifacts](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/rest/manage-finished-builds.html#Get+Build+Artifacts).

relatedIssues.description: Returns the list of issues associated with changes processed in this build.

properties.description: Returns the collection of custom build properties (including those added by users in the Run Custom Build dialog) and their current values.

resultingProperties.description: Returns the complete list of predefined and custom properties with their final values. Final values are those reported by a build agent after a build finishes. These include values changed during a build and via the Run Custom Build dialog.

originalProperties.description: Returns the collection of user-defined properties and their original values. Original values are those stored in the build configuration and assigned to any new build that runs with default settings.

startProperties.description: Returns the complete list of predefined and custom properties with their starting values. Starting values are those reported by a build agent when a build actually starts. These are a combination of original values (see *originalProperties*) for properties that were not modified, and custom values for properties edited via the Run Custom Build dialog.

attributes.description: Returns the list of Entries owned by this build.

statistics.description: Returns the list of statistical metrics for the current build (*ArtifactsSize*, *BuildDuration*, *SuccessRate*, *TimeSpentInQueue*, and so on).

metadata.description: Returns the metadata associated with this build.

snapshot-dependencies.description:
Returns all upstream builds on which the current build depends. In the BuildA  BuildB  BuildC chain, this property returns:

* empty array for BuildA;* array with BuildA for BuildB;* array with BuildA and BuildB for BuildC.

artifact-dependencies.description: Returns all upstream builds whose artifacts were exported to this build.

custom-artifact-dependencies.description: Allows you to override artifact dependencies specified in Build Configuration settings and specify custom dependencies for this specific build. See this section for the sample payload: [Manage Dependencies](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/rest/manage-build-configuration-details.html#Manage+Dependencies).

triggeringOptions.description: Allows you to define custom triggering options (for example, whether the build should get the top spot in the build queue or force clean its sources).

usedByOtherBuilds.description: Returns *true* if at least one dependent build has [reused this build](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/snapshot-dependencies.html#Suitable+Builds) instead of triggering a new one.

statusChangeComment.description: Returns the Comment object that stores information about user who changed the status of this build, and their notes regarding this change.This property may be deprecated in future API versions, use *...Info* properties (*approvalInfo*, *canceledInfo*, and so on) instead.

vcsLabels.description: Returns a list of [labels](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/vcs-labeling.html) that tag sources of this particular build.

detachedFromAgent.description: Returns *true*, if running build no longer [occupies a build agent](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/detaching-build-from-agent.html); otherwise, *false*.

finishOnAgentDate.description: Similar to the *finishDate* property, but adjusts the date and time according to the agent timezone.

customized.description: Returns *true* if the build is running with non-default parameter, dependency, and (or) changes settings (for example, reuses the manually selected build or targets the specific changes revision instead of building latest changes); otherwise, *false*.

customization.description: Returns the list of settings that differentiate this build from a default build of the same build configuration.

changesCollectingInProgress.description: Returns *true* if the build is currently collecting changes from a remote repository; otherwise, *false*.

queuedWaitReasons.description: Returns all reasons why this build remains queued. Use *waitReason* to obtain the primary reason displayed in TeamCity UI.

downloadedArtifacts.description: Returns the collection metadata objects associated with artifacts that were downloaded from dependencies of this build, or exported to builds dependent of the current one.

matrixConfiguration.description: Specifies whether this build belongs to a [Matrix builds](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/matrix-build.html) configuration.

firstBuildWithSameChanges.description: For history builds (builds whose *history* property is *true*), returns the most recent finished build that processed the same revision of the source code.

build.description:
A process that performs a certain CI/CD job. Most builds comprise multiple sequential steps executing their own granular actions. A build is executed according to the settings specified in its build configuration (BuildType). 

See the [Manage Builds](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/rest/start-and-cancel-builds.html) section for the examples on various build actions.

comment.description: A note that explains why this build was canceled. This note will be written to the canceled build's `build.canceledInfo.text` property.

readdIntoQueue.description: If *true*, a new identical build will be queued as soon as the current build is canceled. If *false*, a build will simply be canceled. Similarly to TeamCity UI, the option to re-queue a build is only available if this build is already running. Builds that are still queued can be only aborted.

buildCancelRequest.description: Send a POST request with this object as a payload to cancel a queued (the `/app/rest/buildQueue/<queuedBuildLocator>` endpoint)or already running (the `/app/rest/builds/<buildLocator>` endpoint) build.

nextBuild.description: A source build that provided artifacts for a currently inspected consumer build.

prevBuild.description: If there was a preceding consumer build that obtained its artifacts from a different source build (compared to the currently inspected build), returns this different source build. Otherwise, if there was no preceding consumer build or it obtained its artifacts from the same build, returns *null*.

buildChange.description:
If builds of a consumer build configuration import build artifacts from builds of a source build configuration, BuildChange objects allow you to identify whether consecutive consumer builds obtain artifacts from different source builds or the same one. 

See [Build.ArtifactDependencyChanges](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/rest/build.html#artifactDependencyChanges) for more information.

count.description: The current number of BuildChange objects in this list.

buildChange.description: The list of BuildChange objects owned by this collection.

buildChanges.description: Represents a list of BuildChange entities.

cleanSources.description: Returns *true* if the agent should clear its build checkout directory and pull all sources anew; otherwise, *false*.

cleanSourcesInAllDependencies.description: Returns *true* if the current 'cleanSources' behavior also be applied to all snapshot dependency builds, otherwise, *false*.

rebuildAllDependencies.description: Use *true* to prevent the build from reusing any of its snapshot dependency builds and re-run all dependency configurations; *false* to let TeamCity decide which snapshot builds should be re-run and which have [suitable builds]()https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/snapshot-dependencies.html#Suitable+Builds.

rebuildFailedOrIncompleteDependencies.description: *true* to re-run all failed, failed to start, and canceled snapshot dependency builds; *false* to let TeamCity decide which snapshot builds should be re-run and which have [suitable builds]()https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/snapshot-dependencies.html#Suitable+Builds.

queueAtTop.description: *true* to place the build at the top spot of the build queue, *false* to let TeamCity automatically process this build.

freezeSettings.description: Use *true* to collect all code commits and versioned settings right away; *false* to do this when build is assigned to the agent and is ready to start.

tagDependencies.description: Use *true* to label all dependency builds with tags specified in the `Build.Tags` field; *false* to label the current build only.

rebuildDependencies.description: The list of snapshot dependencies that should be rebuilt. Should only be used when both `rebuildAllDependencies` and `rebuildFailedOrIncompleteDependencies` fields equal *false*.

buildTriggeringOptions.description: Contains build dependency and queue and dependency settings available in the [Run Custom Build](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/running-custom-build.html) dialog in TeamCity UI. Assign an instance of this class to the Build.TriggeringOptions field when sending POST requests to the `/app/rest/buildQueue` endpoint.

id.description: The build configuration ID. Typically consists of a trunkated project and configuration names in the ProjectName_ConfigurationName format.

internalId.description: The automatically generated build configuration ID. This is the internal property and is not intented to be used.

name.description: The public build configuration name displayed in TeamCity UI.

templateFlag.description: Returns *true* if the current BuildType entity is a build configuration template; *false* if this is a regular build configuration. Inspect the `templates` field to view all templates attached to the target configuration.

type.description:
The build configuration type:

* *regular*  a regular build configuration.
* *composite*  a composite configuration that aggregates results of multiple upstream build chain configurations.
* *deployment*  a deployment build configuration.

See [Changing build configuration type](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/changing-build-configuration-type.html) for more information.

paused.description: Returns *true* if a configuration is paused and cannot start new builds automatically upon build trigger requests; otherwise, *false*. To pause or unpause a configuration, use the configuration's Actions menu in TeamCity UI or send a `PUT` request with the required Boolean value to the `/app/rest/buildTypes/_build_type_locator_/paused` endpoint.

uuid.description: An internally used universally unique identifier.

description.example: Deploys artifacts to the public registry
description.description: The custom build configuration description, or *null* if not set.

projectName.description: The public name of a parent TeamCity project.

projectId.description: The ID of a parent TeamCity project that owns this build configuration.

projectInternalId.description: The automatically generated ID of a parent project. This is the internal property and is not intented to be used.

href.description: The short link (without the address of a TeamCity server) to this build configuration.

webUrl.description: The regular URL for this build configuration or template.

inherited.description: Returns *null* for build configurations, *true* for configuration templates inherited from other templates, and *false* for regular templates extracted from build configurations. You can only create templates inherited from other base templates in Kotlin.

links.description: URL links for editing and viewing this build configuration.

project.description: The project that owns this build configuration or template.

templates.description: The list of all build configuration templates currently attached to this build configuration.

template.description: The first template from the `templates` collection. This field is only in effect for older versions of TeamCity where only one template could be attached to a build configuration.

vcs-root-entries.description: A collection of VcsEntry objects, which store attached VcsRoot objects coupled with their unique checkout rules for this build configuration.

settings.description: The list of build configuration settings. For example, its branch filter, current build number counter, and others.

parameters.description: The list of input parameters. Input parameters are designed to be used directly in their parent configuration. Includes parameters inherited from configuration's parent project(s).

output-parameters.description: The list of output parameters. Output parameters can be accessed by other configurations within the same build chain via the `dep.config_id.parameter_name` syntax. Does not duplicate the list of input parameters if the `All parameters are available to other build configurations` setting of a configuration is enabled.

steps.description: The list of enabled and disabled build steps owned by this configuration.

features.description: The list of enabled and disabled build features added to this configuration.

triggers.description: The list of build triggers configured in this configuration. Build triggers allow configurations to automatically start new builds when specific conditions are met. Triggers do not launch new builds for `paused` configurations.

snapshot-dependencies.description: The list of snapshot dependencies that specify which configurations must finish their builds before this configuration can run its build.

artifact-dependencies.description: The list of artifact dependencies that specify which files published by other build configurations must be imported to this configuration.

agent-requirements.description: The list of agent requirements that specify which build agents are eligible to run builds of this configuration. Does not include implicit build steps requirements.

branches.description: The list of repository branches that can be built in this build configuration. Supported branches are specified by the branch specs of attached VCS roots, and then filtered by configuration's branch filter (`buildType.settings.branchFilter`).

builds.description: Stores all builds spawned from this build configuration.

investigations.description: Stores active investigations for a build configuration. Note that this list stores investigations assigned on a build configuration level, and does not include investigations of individual build problems assigned from the build results page.

compatibleAgents.description: The list of build agents that are eligible to run builds of this configuration.

compatibleCloudImages.description: The list of cloud images that can spawn build agents eligible to run builds of this configuration.

vcsRootInstances.description: A collection of VcsRootInstance objects, which store customized clones of a VcsRoot.

externalStatusAllowed.description: This is the internal property and is not intented to be used.

pauseComment.description: A Comment entity storing the TeamCity user, date, and optional note for the last pause or unpause action on this configuration.

buildType.description: A build configuration owned by a TeamCity project, or a template created from this configuration. Spawns builds to execute configured build steps.

count.description: The number of build types in this collection.

href.description: The relative link (without the server URL) to the current collection.

nextHref.description: If the list of returned entities exceeds the request `count` value, TeamCity splits it into multiple batches. This property returns the endpoint that allows you to obtain the next batch.

prevHref.description: If the list of returned entities exceeds the request `count` value, TeamCity splits it into multiple batches. This property returns the endpoint that allows you to obtain the next batch.

buildType.description: The list of build types owned by this collection that satisfy the given locator.

buildTypes.description: Represents a paginated list of BuildType entities.

count.description: The current number of Build objects in this list.

build.description: The list of builds owned by this collection that satisfy the given locator.

prevHref.description: If the list of returned entities exceeds the request `count` value, TeamCity splits it into multiple batches. This property returns the endpoint that allows you to obtain the previous batch.

nextHref.description: If the list of returned entities exceeds the request `count` value, TeamCity splits it into multiple batches. This property returns the endpoint that allows you to obtain the next batch.

href.description: The relative link (without the server URL) used to retrieve this object.

builds.description: Represents a paginated list of Build entities.
The list of builds that cannot start without an approval.

approvalReason.description: The reason why the builds from the *builds* field require an explicit approval.

buildsWithReason.description: Stores builds that cannot be started without an explicit approval, along with reasons why these builds require an approval.

id.description: The unique ID of this change object.

version.description: The full revision SHA that corresponds to this change, or a time stamp of a personal build that processed a custom diff

username.description: This property is obsolete. To identify the change author, read the `commiter` property instead.

date.description: Returns the timestamp that corresponds to the moment this change was pushed to the VCS. If this is a custom change uploaded to a personal build, returns the timestamp of this build instead.

registrationDate.description: Returns the timestamp that corresponds to the moment this change was registered in the TeamCity database.

personal.description: Returns *true* if this change was a custom patch uploaded to a personal build. If this is a regular change that comes from a VCS (even if the build that processed it is a personal one), returns *false*.

href.description: Returns the shortened (without the server URL) link to the current change.

webUrl.description: The TeamCity server link to this change.

type.description:
Specifies the origin of the change.

* *VCS_CHANGE*  the regular change that originates from a repository related to the target build.
* *SNAPSHOT_DEPENDENCY_VCS_CHANGE*  the change is processed in another build on which the target build depends (via the snapshot dependency). Add the `changesFromDependencies:true` locator to your request if you want the response to include changes processed in upstream chain builds.

snapshotDependencyLink.description: If a change has the `SNAPSHOT_DEPENDENCY_VCS_CHANGE` type, it was processed in an upstream build of a build chain. The *snapshotDependencyLink* property points to this upstream build that processed this change.

attributes.description: The list of parameters introduced in these changes.

status.description: Returns an object that stores information about this change in terms of effects it had on the TeamCity server: the number of failed/cancelled/successful builds, the number of build configurations that have this change in the pending changes list, the number of build problems and failed tests caused by this change, and so on.

commiter.description: Returns the object that contains information about the change author. Inludes both VCS and TeamCity user data.

locator.description: This property supports the internal infrastructure and is not intended to be used in your code.

Returns whether the agent can run only builds of specific build configurations. Available values:

* *any*  agents with this policy can run builds of any build configurations.
* *selected*  agents with this policy can only run builds of configurations stored in the `buildTypes` collection.

* *TAKEN*  the investigation is assigned to a TeamCity user who works on resolving the problem.
* *FIXED*  the investigation was marked as fixed.
* *GIVEN_UP*  the investigation is no longer active, the 'no investigation' option was selected.
* *NONE*  unknown investigation status.

newBuildTypeDescription.description:
A stub object that represents a newly created build configuration (build type). Objects of the `NewBuildTypeDescription` type can be used to do the following: 

* **Copy an existing build configurations**. POST a `NewBuildTypeDescription` object with the specified `sourceBuildType` property to the `/app/rest/projects/_target_project_locator_/buildTypes` endpoint.
* **Create a new build configurations and templates**. POST a `NewBuildTypeDescription` object with required properties (`name` is required) to the `/app/rest/projects/_parent_project_locator_/buildTypes` or `/app/rest/projects/_parent_project_locator_/templates` endpoint.

investigations.description: The relative (without TeamCity server URL) endpoint that allows you to access problem investigations.

mutes.description: The relative (without TeamCity server URL) endpoint that allows you to access muted problems.

artifactsUrl.description: Returns the artifacts isolation URL: the URL of a separate domain that stores build artifacts and mitigates the risk of TeamCity server attacks carried out by users who access these artifacts. If the isolation URL is not set (default setup), returns an empty string.

nodes.description: The relative (without TeamCity server URL) endpoint that allows you to access all nodes of a setup to which the current server belongs.

server.description: Stores extensive information about the current TeamCity server instance.

allowGuest.description: **true** if users can log into TeamCity as [guests](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/enabling-guest-login.html); **false** if only registered users can access TeamCity.

guestUsername.description: The default username for all users logged in as guests.

welcomeText.description: The custom text displayed on the TeamCity log in page.

collapseLoginForm.description: **true** if the username/password fields on the login page is collapsed by default, promoting authentication via third-party services. **false** if the username/password fields are initially visible.

perProjectPermissions.description: **true** if the [per-project authorization mode](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/teamcity/managing-roles-and-permissions.html#Per-Project+Authorization+Mode) is enabled; otherwise, **false**.

emailVerification.description: **true** if users must enter their emails on registration; **false** if they can skip this setting.

buildAuthenticationMode.description: **strict** if builds can access only their own projects, projects that own VCS roots, and artifact dependencies projects. **lax** if builds have elevated permissions to access any project on the server (the default behavior).

serverAuthSettings.description: Stores settings that manage users accessing the TeamCity server.Use the `/app/rest/server/authSettings` endpoint to view and edit these settings, or navigate to **Admin | Authentication** page in TeamCity UI.

defaultVCSCheckInterval.description: An Integer value that specifies how often (in seconds) TeamCity polls VCS repositories for changes. The default value is 60 seconds.

defaultExecutionTimeout.description: The maximum allowed build duration. Zero or negative values mean no time limit.

artifactDirectories.description: A String containing the concatenated paths to the artifact directories used by the server. Paths are separated using the new line characters.

defaultQuietPeriod.description: The delay (in seconds) between a moment TeamCity detects a new VCS change and a moment a new build processing this change starts. Individual build configuration triggers can override this global setting.

enforceDefaultVCSCheckInterval.description: **true**, if project administrators cannot set the polling interval in VCS root settings lower than the `defaultVCSCheckInterval`; otherwise, **false**.

artifactsDomainIsolation.description: **true** if TeamCity publishes build artifacts to a separate domain; **false** if the artifacts can be accessed from the regular TeamCity server URL.

useEncryption.description: **true** if TeamCity encrypts all sensitive values using a custom key; **false** if it uses the defaul scrambled mechanism for these values.

encryptionKey.description: Returns the encryption key. This property is hidden from the payload.

maxArtifactSize.description: The maximum allowed artifact size (in bytes), or `-1` if there is no size limit. Artifacts that exceed these limit will not be published.

artifactsUrl.description: If `artifactsDomainIsolation` is set to **true**, this property returns the URL of the artifacts isolation domain.

maxArtifactsNumber.description: The maximum number of artifacts that can be published per build, or `-1` if there is no limit. This number does not include hidden artifacts.

serverGlobalSettings.description: Stores global TeamCity server settings that affect all projects on this server. These settings are accessible via TeamCity UI from the **Admin | Global Settings** page. Use the `/app/rest/server/globalSettings` to view and edit these settings.

count.description: The number of `snapshot-dependency` objects in this collection.

snapshot-dependency.description: The list of `snapshot-dependency` objects owned by this collection.

snapshot-dependencies.description: Represents a list of SnapshotDependency entities.

id.description: The internal read-only ID of the object. This property is inherited from the base PropEntity class.

name.description: The public object name. Some objects, like build steps, support public names, while others, like build triggers, do not. This property is inherited from the base PropEntity class.

type.description: The object type. This property is inherited from the base PropEntity class.

disabled.description: Returns **rue** if the object is disabled and inactive; otherwise, **false**. This property is inherited from the base PropEntity class.

inherited.description: Returns **rue** if the object is inherited from another object; otherwise, **false**. This property is inherited from the base PropEntity class.

href.description: Returns the shortened (without the server URL) link to the current object. This property is inherited from the base PropEntity class.

properties.description: The list of main object settings. Each setting is a Property instance with `name` and `value` fields. This property is inherited from the base PropEntity class.

source-buildType.description: The upstream configuration of a build chain that must finish its build before the current downstream configuration can run.

snapshot-dependency.description: A snapshot dependency that specifies the relation between the current (dependent) downstream configuration of a build chain, and an upstream configuration on which the current configuration depends.

shortDescription.description: The short description of this build step, displayed in the list of configuration steps in TeamCity UI.

step.description: A build step: the smallest unit of a CI/CD routine within a build configuration or template, encapsulating a set of indivisible build instructions.

count.description: The number of build steps in this collection.

step.description: Build steps owned by this collection.

steps.description: Represents a list of Step entities.

name.description: The public tag name visible in TeamCity UI.

tag.description: A single build tag. To remove a specific tag from a build, send a PUT request to the `/app/rest/builds/BUILD_LOCATOR?locator=name:NAME` endpoint with an empty `name` value.

count.description: The current number of Tag objects in this list.

tag.description: The list of tags owned by this collection that satisfy the given locator.

tags.description: Represents a list of Tag entities.

testCounters.description: Represents a test results counter (how many times this test was successful/failed/muted/ignored).

testOccurrence.description: Represents a relation between a test and the specific build.

testOccurrences.description: Represents a paginated list of TestOccurrence entities.

testRunMetadata.description: Represents a list of TypedValue entities.

tests.description: Represents a paginated list of Test entities.

tokens.description: Represents a list of Token entities.

name.description: The public object name. Some objects, like build steps, support public names, while others, like build triggers, do not. This property is inherited from the base PropEntity class.
