buildCustomization.description: A BuildTriggerCustomization object that allows triggers to start customized builds. For example, alter parameter values or enforce clean checkout.

trigger.description: A build trigger that automatically starts new builds when specified criteria are met.

count.description: The number of triggers in this collection.

trigger.description: The list of triggers owned by this collection.

triggers.description: Represents a list of Trigger entities.

type.description: Represents a build parameter type string.

user.description: A TeamCity user that must approve a build before it can start.

approved.description: Returns *true* if this user already approved the build; otherwise, *false*

userApprovalRule.description: An individual user approval rule and its current status for the given build.

count.description: The number of UserApprovalRule objects in this collection.

userApproval.description: The list of UserApprovalRule stored in this collection.

userApprovals.description: Represents a list of UserApprovalRule entities.

userAvatars.description: Represents a group of links to the user's avatars

users.description: Represents a list of User entities.

id.description: The unique ID of the root. Typically consists of trunkated parent project ID and root name.

internalId.description: The internal read-only ID of the root.

uuid.description: The internal read-only UUID of the root.

name.description: The public root name displayed in TeamCity UI.

vcsName.description: The type of a VCS provider to which this root connects.

modificationCheckInterval.description: The interval (in seconds) for polling VCS for new changes. Equals **null** if this root uses default server polling interval.

href.description: The short (without the TeamCity server address) link to this VCS root.

project.description: The TeamCity project that owns this VCS root.

properties.description: The list of VCS root settings, such as clean policy, auth method, default repository branch name, and more.

vcsRootInstances.description: The list of [VcsRootInstance](VcsRootInstance.md) objects spawned from this VCS root. If all root settings are static, it produces one root instance that can be attached to one or multiple configurations. In turn, if some of the root settings use parameter references (for example, `{'name':'branch','value':'%main-branch%'}`), a different VcsRootInstance is spawned for each build configuration that has a unique `main-branch` property value. In this case a single VcsRoot has multiple corresponding VcsRootInstances.

repositoryIdStrings.description: The list of internally used repository IDs.

locator.description: The part of the `href` property value that specifies the object locator. Ommitted from regular responses.

vcs-root.description: A VCS root stores repository connection settings. TeamCity uses VCS roots to create [VcsRootInstance](vcsRootInstance.md) objects, enabling build configurations and features to interact with remote repositories for source checkout, build status publishing, and more.

count.description: The number of `vcs-root-entry` objects in this collection.

vcs-root-entry.description: The list of `vcs-root-entry` objects owned by this collection.

vcs-root-entries.description: Represents a list of VcsRootEntry entities.

id.description: The ID of the attached VCS root.

inherited.description: This is the internal property and is not intented to be used.

checkout-rules.description: Checkout rules that allow configurations to partially checkout remote repositories.

vcs-root-entry.description: A VCS root attached to a configuration coupled with this configuration's checkout rules.

id.description: The internal read-only ID of this root instance.

vcs-root-id.description: The ID of a parent VcsRoot.

vcsRootInternalId.description: The internal ID of a parent VcsRoot

name.description: The public name of a parent VcsRoot.

vcsName.description: The type of a VCS provider to which the parent VcsRoot connects.

modificationCheckInterval.description: The actual interval (in seconds) for polling VCS for new changes.

commitHookMode.description: Returns **true** if the configuration uses post-commit hooks to get new repository changes' notifications; **false** if pending changes are retrieved via periodic repository polling.

lastVersion.description: The latest revision of a remote repository branch targeted by this root instance.

lastVersionInternal.description: This is the internal property and is not intented to be used.

href.description: The short (without TeamCity server address) link to this root instance.

vcs-root.description: The parent VCS root of this VCS root instance.

status.description: Stores results of both current and previous VCS root checkups.

repositoryState.description: A RepositoryState object that stores the list of available repository branches with their latest revisions.

properties.description: The list of actual VCS root instance settings, including values resolved from parameter references used in a parent VCS root.

repositoryIdStrings.description: The list of internally used repository IDs.

vcs-root-instance.description: An instance of the VCS root. VCS roots are abstract storages of VCS connection settings that cannot be used directly. Build configurations, triggers, build features, and other TeamCity entities use instances of corresponding VCS roots to perform their tasks (checkout sources, post build statuses, and so on). If a root includes parameter references in its settings (for example, `{'name':'branch','value':'%main-branch%'}`), it spawns a separate instance for each configuration that has a unique value for that parameter. Otherwise, if all root settings are static, it generates one instance that can be attached to any number of build configurations.

count.description: The number of root instances in this collection.

href.description: The relative link (without the server URL) to the current collection.

nextHref.description: If the list of returned entities exceeds the request `count` value, TeamCity splits it into multiple batches. This property returns the endpoint that allows you to obtain the next batch.

prevHref.description: If the list of returned entities exceeds the request `count` value, TeamCity splits it into multiple batches. This property returns the endpoint that allows you to obtain the previous batch.

vcs-root-instance.description: The list of root instances owned by this collection that satisfy the given locator.

vcs-root-instances.description: Represents a paginated list of VcsRootInstance entities.

count.description: The number of roots in this collection.

href.description: The relative link (without the server URL) to the current collection.

nextHref.description: If the list of returned entities exceeds the request `count` value, TeamCity splits it into multiple batches. This property returns the endpoint that allows you to obtain the next batch.

prevHref.description: If the list of returned entities exceeds the request `count` value, TeamCity splits it into multiple batches. This property returns the endpoint that allows you to obtain the previous batch.

vcs-root.description: The list of roots owned by this collection that satisfy the given locator.

vcs-roots.description: Represents a paginated list of VcsRoot entities.

failureReason.description: The reason why the sources could not be labeled. Provides additional information why the `status` field returns FAILED.

status.description:
The status of the labeling (tagging) operation. Possible values: 

* *UNKNOWN*  the operation status is currently unknown.
* *SUCCESSFUL_SET*  the sources were successfully tagged.
* *IS_BEING_SET*  the labeling (tagging) process is currently ongoing.
* *FAILED*  the sources could not be labeled.
* *DISABLED_FOR_THE_ROOT*  the current root is excluded from the labeling process.
* *LABELING_NOT_SUPPORTED*  VCS does not support labeling.

buildId.description: The internal ID of the build during which the sources were tagged.

vcs-root-instance.description: The instance of a VCS root that was used during the tagging process.

vcsLabel.description: The VCS-side tag that labels sources of this build.

count.description: The current number of VcsLabel objects in this list.

vcsLabel.description: The list of VcsLabels owned by this collection that satisfy the given locator.

vcsLabels.description: Represents a list of VcsLabel entities.

vcsStatus.description: Stores two latest VcsCheckStatus objects that store information about changes checks.
